talk.author: did:plc:yh4mnskrnoiy3auxzoopoo5j
talk.utter: But for each new person there are three more spaces. Doesn't matter if they are shared, there are still more than can ever be filled by cars by a factor of three.

talk.author: did:plc:vk5ub6lpjfhm6uljrtro55wd
talk.utter: To assert that, you would have to show how many cars there are against how many car parking spaces there are in the UK. Give me some stats.

talk.author: did:plc:yh4mnskrnoiy3auxzoopoo5j
talk.utter: It wasn't my assertion, but a quick Google search suggests there are 1-2 billion parking spaces in the USA for just under 300 million registered vehicles. So the overall factor may be even worse than 3. Just a cursory search though, I will leave the deep dive to someone else.
